section.title: Order by Score
section.para: Select all nodes with the mixin type 'mix:title' containing any word from the set {'brown','fox','jumps'}. Then sort result by the score in ascending node. This way nodes that matches better the query statement are ordered at the last positions in the result list.

section.title: Info
section.para: SQL and XPath queries support both score constructions jcr:score and jcr:score()
Do not use "ascending" combined with jcr:score in XPath. The following XPath statement may throw an exception:
Do not set any ordering specifier - ascending is default:

section.title: Repository Structure
section.para: The repository contains mix:title nodes, where the jcr:description has different values.

listitem.para: document1 (mix:title) jcr:description="The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."
document2 (mix:title) jcr:description="The brown fox lives in the forest."
document3 (mix:title) jcr:description="The fox is a nice animal."

section.title: Query Execution
Fetching the Result
section.para: NodeIterator will return nodes in the following order: "document3", "document2", "document1".
We can also get a table:

row.entry: The fox is a nice animal.
The brown fox lives in the forest.
The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.
